articles.title: Surging demand and higher prices fuel organic strawberry expansion
articles.summary: Organic strawberry nursery sales have increased year-over-year since 2020, with prices rising 3-5% annually. Wellness trends are driving demand for pesticide-free berries. articles.title: Florida strawberry levels increasing after freeze recovery
articles.summary: Florida strawberry supply is recovering after being down 50% for two weeks due to a freeze. With warmer weather returning, production is expected to pick up sharply. Growers are confident of covering Valentine's Day commitments. Supply transitions from Chile and Peru blueberries to Florida from early March.

articles.title: Extreme weather in Huelva: 'I haven't seen conditions this extreme in more than 30 years'
articles.summary: Severe rain and wind in February 2026 are causing major damage to Huelva strawberry and raspberry plots. Limited availability is keeping prices high but fruit quality is impacted. Northern Morocco is also flooded, reducing competing supply to European markets and tightening overall berry availability.

articles.title: Spain's berry production down 3.4% — strawberry and raspberry supply falls, blueberry up 5.5%
articles.summary: Spain's berry sector contracted 3.4% to 371,713 tons due to reduced strawberry and raspberry acreage driven by irrigation water uncertainty. Blueberry production bucked the trend with a 5.5% increase. Only Cuna de Platero, Algaida, and Berryworld Iberia reported volume increases among the Top 15 producers.
